    • Method Detail

      • createCRLs

        int createCRLs​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin)
        throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method that checks if there are any CRLs needed to be updated and then creates their CRLs. No overlap is used. This method can be called by a scheduler or a service.
        Parameters:
        admin - administrator performing the task
        Returns:
        crl
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • createDeltaCRLs

        int createDeltaCRLs​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin)
             throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method that checks if there are any delta CRLs needed to be updated and then creates their delta CRLs. No overlap is used. This method can be called by a scheduler or a service.
        Parameters:
        admin - administrator performing the task
        Returns:
        crl
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail

      • createCRLNewTransactionConditioned

        boolean createCRLNewTransactionConditioned​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                           int caid,
                                           long addtocrloverlaptime)
                                    throws org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                                           org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException,
                                           org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                                           org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method that checks if the CRL is needed to be updated for the CA and creates the CRL, if necessary. A CRL is created: 1. if the current CRL expires within the crloverlaptime (milliseconds) 2. if a CRL issue interval is defined (>0) a CRL is issued when this interval has passed, even if the current CRL is still valid
        Parameters:
        admin - administrator performing the task
        caid - the id of the CA this operation regards
        addtocrloverlaptime - given in milliseconds and added to the CRL overlap time, if set to how often this method is run (poll time), it can be used to issue a new CRL if the current one expires within the CRL overlap time (configured in CA) and the poll time. The used CRL overlap time will be (crloverlaptime + addtocrloverlaptime)
        Returns:
        true if a CRL was created
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException - fail
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - fail
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        javax.ejb.EJBException - if communication or system error occurs

      • forceCRL

        boolean forceCRL​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                 int caid)
          throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
                 org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                 org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException,
                 org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException
        Method that forces generation of a CRL for a certain CA
        Parameters:
        admin - administrator performing the task
        caid - the id of the CA this operation regards
        Returns:
        true if a CRL was generated
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - fail
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        org.cesecore.keys.token.CryptoTokenOfflineException - fail
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAOfflineException - fail
